meta.title: infra status-evidence truthfulness reconciliation
meta.summary: Reconcile deployment infra status and evidence docs to repo-verifiable truth and remove unsupported assertions.

task.objective: Reconcile deployment infrastructure status and evidence documentation so all statements are truthful, internally consistent, and directly supported by repo-verifiable artifacts.
constraints: Limit edits to directive/task artifacts and deployment operations/reference documentation.
Do not introduce claims that cannot be validated from repository artifacts or explicit command output.
Do not edit product implementation code in this task.
Keep status/evidence language explicit about certainty level when evidence is partial.

steps.instruction: Review current infra status and evidence documents; enumerate statements that require direct repository evidence.
Cross-check each statement against available repo artifacts and command-verifiable facts; mark unsupported assertions for correction or removal.
Update status/evidence documents to reflect verified truth only, including explicit unknown/pending markers where evidence is incomplete.
Validate document consistency against deployment model references and runbook session validation requirements.

expected_output: Infra status and evidence docs contain only repo-verifiable claims or explicitly marked unknowns.
Unsupported or stale assertions are removed or corrected.
stop_conditions: Stop if required factual claims depend on external systems not observable from repository context.
Stop if reconciling documentation truth would require performing production mutations or deployment actions.
